captions.text: They say things, they try to stop us
We're dying in love with each other
Don't look at me like that, with those eyes
as you see, just a little different
in a world that has stopped
We're dying in love with each other
Don't look at me like that, with those eyes
as you see, just a little different
I just want to love the way I feel
It won't change no matter what anyone says
Don't look at me like that, with those eyes
as you see, just a little different

comments.text:
After listening to this song first time I fell in love with it. After 
reading English translation, I fell in love with the lyrics making this 
song even more meaningful. I am convinced this song is about forbidden 
love: meaning homo/biosexula, or interracial, or older/younger woman/man or 
perhaps sex before marriage. I believe this song applies to any of those 
situations above - that is why it's not directly stated as it could apply 
to various situations. It's just my opinion....﻿

comments.author: Giulia Prates

comments.text:
I don't understand why people are saying this song is about "idol love". 
Idols get criticized but they aren't shunned by society. Yeah, some anti's 
or fans pretty much get butthurt and insult them (Idols) but that's nothing 
compared to people who are in HOMOSEXUAL and relationships with AGE GAPS 
where they are looked down upon family, friends and society in general. 
Song leans more towards taboo love then idol love tbh.﻿
comments.author: xmochilove

comments.text: wooooow i like this song its about my life ^_^ thank you﻿
comments.author: batoul nassef

comments.text:
Well- I found this song yesterday (yeah late) and I don't think it relates 
to any idol love? Tbh that's not considered forbidden love if fans are just 
against the relationship. That is what we call "so called forbidden love 
among jealous and in denial fans". Yeah company doesn't allow it until they 
reach a certain age but they did that for a reason. And I think idols 
understand that too. 

It leans more towards same gender love. "Don't Look At Me Like That" don't 
look at her as if she's abnormal and disgusting. Idols don't go out 
publicly and people won't even have the chance to look at them lol xD 
reporters just report and stuff. Netizens judge them through internet, not 
directly in front of them. 

A lot of you refer to baekyeon but meh. They were (mainly) hated because 
they broke their promises. Only a couple of them hated on them bcs they're 
dating xD (p.s. idc if they are dating orz)

And homosexuality gets cursed very straightforwardly tbvh. Even in public.

Soo- tadahhhh. The conclusion has been made. It's not idol love o u o﻿
comments.author: markson & hunhan refuse to stop

yeah whoever thought this song is about idol love is a bit delusional. it's

comments.text:
ANGSTY!

But really! What a powerful song. She's very brave to put this up since 
homosexual relationships and of the sort have been looked down by the 
society, and when this mostly got negative feedback, I don't even get why 
but again: society. She should be proud of this because she conveyed the 
message perfectly. And it's also a great song on its own, even without 
learning the meaning behind it.

And if anyone's still having trouble accepting or still curious about the 
real meaning of this song, please read the description!﻿

comments.author: 聶祖元（Richard）

comments.text:
I am calm.  You come off pretty narrow minded.   Lyric is about prejudiced 
love.  Some society/family discourage young love such as seeing someone who 
you are not prearranged to, fans judge and sent hate mail to their bias 
idol for dating.  Why are you trivializing those kind of love?  All love is 
precious to the people involved and matters to them.  Ultimately this song 
and lyric will have deep meaning for them.  You  remind me of the masked 
character in mv making judgement about love and which matters.
comments.author: morninghope1

comments.text:
+morninghope1 Um, calm down. I said that in a positive way. The song is too 
sad to be about teenage or idol + idol love.. If you're going to adjust the 
song to your own perspective at least make it about an issue that actually 
matters.
comments.author: UltimateFashionist

comments.text:
How are you guessing that?  Because the song did not explicitly stated what 
kind of love, it's up to the individual to decide.  We do know that the 
song sang about a kind of love that society do not approve and thus are 
judged upon.  Based on the indiv perspective, it could be same sex, 
interracial, teenage love, young/old, idol among idol etc etc etc.  That 
mood and the lyric allows different people to relate and I feel that's part 
of the beauty and magic of this song.  Love Song Ji Eun's dark songs. She's 
the best.

comments.text:
송지은 노래 존나 잘 부르는데 지코드가 지랄 같아서 그냥 네 스타일은 그냥 딱 작지만 존나 강한 스타일이 딱이다 예를 들에 남자가 
좋다고 개소리 한걸 그때는 사랑이 인줄 알고 사겼는데 씨발새끼가 존나 쉽게 본거 같은 느낌이 점점들어 참다 참다 존나 빡쳤는데 그래도 
믿었는데 개새끼 였다 너같은 새끼 만난걸 너무 후회한다 내자신이 미워 죽고 싶은 맘이지만 시바 그냥 더 강해지자 약해지지 말자 이런 
근데 딴 놈만났는데 그놈은 다를꺼라 생각하고 신중했는데 그새끼도 개새끼더라 이런가사 ㅅㅂ 예날 여친 개 쌍년이 내한테 한말ㅋ ㅅㅂ난 
그럼 난머지 ㅅㅂ﻿
